medical_history.chief_complaint: Memory loss and episodes of near-syncope.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms of mild and gradual memory loss began 7 months prior to presentation, with episodes of diffuse tingling and flushing occurring intermittently. Four months prior, light-headedness and difficulty with word finding developed, progressing to near-syncope 4 weeks before presentation. The patient also reported an intermittently irregular pulse and increasing anxiety and mild depression after retirement.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Borderline hypertension, lumbar disk disease, pseudogout, decreased hearing, and a history of slipping on ice 4 months prior with resultant ruptured right quadriceps tendon. Patient is allergic to penicillin.
medical_history.family_history: Father died at age 94 from cerebrovascular disease, mother at age 76 from a brain tumor, and two sisters died in their 50s or 60s from strokes. One sister and her children are healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Lived with wife, retired 1 year ago due to memory loss, reported anxiety and mild depression post-retirement, consumed 30 to 60 ml of alcohol daily, and smoked previously but stopped years ago.
